intro: Descurainia paradisa var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada paradise fleaweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features small, yellow flowers and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. It typically thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is noted for its resilience to drought and its ability to colonize disturbed areas.
